answers.answer: Hello.How are the blood sugar levels? Does she have type II diabetes?Did your sister have symptoms of peripheral neuropathy such as tingling and numbness on toes and fingers to start with?Her bladder problem and the leg pain can be due to diabetic neuropathy. Can you get nerve conduction study done?Regards

She has a glucose test two weeks ago, and they said that her levels are high but that's not what is concerning them right now. The blood work showed high liver levels.  Tomorrow she's going for more tests.  In the past they thought she may have RSD, and that if her circulation didn't get better, she may run the risk of foot amputation.  She wears a device to stimulate circulation.  She also had surgery on her lower back to repair a disc, and it took her boes longer to heal, as they seem rubbery.  (Another diabetic symptom?)

question: I'm very concerned for my sister...her symptoms are no bladder control, severe restless leg syndrome, legs pain, borderline diabetic, and now they say she has high liver emzymes.
title: worried
